meanings.definition: Having greater resources or opportunities than others.
meanings.sent1: The advantaged students had access to more books and technology.
meanings.sent2: She felt advantaged because she had a supportive family and good education.
meanings.sent3: The advantaged team had so many players, they had to take turns playing.
meanings.sent4: In the race of life, being advantaged is like starting with a head start.
meanings.sent5: The advantaged neighborhood sparkled with well-maintained houses and lush gardens.

meanings.definition: To give an advantage to; benefit.
meanings.sent1: The coach advantaged the team by providing extra training sessions.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to advantage her friends by sharing helpful tips.
meanings.sent3: The magician advantaged his performance by adding a surprise twist.
meanings.sent4: A good education can advantage you in many aspects of life.
meanings.sent5: The early morning sunlight advantaged the beautiful flowers in the garden.
